comment.text: I've been running this for 3 days with complete success on F34 and Gnome with X11 and the NVidia proprietary driver.  Normal browsing, media replay, screenshots and addons are all working well.  Conferencing, pinned tabs, anything I've tried with configuration also works well.
I am not sure why the automated test failed, but in general the rpms work, I am using them. I do not have sssd running though.
oh I see it now, https://openqa.fedoraproject.org/tests/903911#step/server_cockpit_default/16 it opens a tab with a new privacy notice or something like that, guessing that creates the problem
Using it for 3 days on KDE spin without any issues so far
Working great for me here on Fedora 34 on Gnome with Wayland (Radeon rx5600m)
Works fine on aarch64 and x86_64 with basic testing.
Just updated to this firefox from stable. It is completely unusable with KDE + wayland + nvidia driver. Browser window is black. Works OK with KDE + X11 + nvidia driver.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

With Firefox-89.0/Fedora 34 we're blocked by some gcc-11.0 bugs:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1710235
https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=100644

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1711811

gcc-11.1.1-3.fc34 should fix it:
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=1757009
sorry, forgot to put a message with the url, gcc 11.1.1-3 is now in stable, koji build succeeded.
Anyone know what's going on with F33? The firefox build for that has been running for days, and there's no corresponding gcc update.

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=69095368 koji build the packages successful but you can see an error message in results. I would say it tried to reach kojipkgs-cache01.s390.fedoraproject.org but it failed. This seems to have stopped the whole workflow.
I can't add the release to bodhi, I am guessing one of the package maintainers has to do this @stransky@redhat.com or @jhorak@redhat.com
FEDORA-2021-af55f610eb has been submitted as an update to Fedora 34. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-af55f610eb

FEDORA-2021-af55f610eb has been pushed to the Fedora 34 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
The needinfo request[s] on this closed bug have been removed as they have been unresolved for 500 days

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by stransky.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'failed'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'failed'.
I am not sure why the automated test failed, but in general the rpms work, I am using them. I do not have sssd running though.
oh I see it now, https://openqa.fedoraproject.org/tests/903911#step/server_cockpit_default/16 it opens a tab with a new privacy notice or something like that, guessing that creates the problem
Using it for 3 days on KDE spin without any issues so far
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
Working great for me here on Fedora 34 on Gnome with Wayland (Radeon rx5600m)
FEDORA-2021-af55f610eb ejected from the push because 'Required tests did not pass on this update'
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
Works fine on aarch64 and x86_64 with basic testing.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'passed'.
This update has been pushed to stable.
Just updated to this firefox from stable. It is completely unusable with KDE + wayland + nvidia driver. Browser window is black. Works OK with KDE + X11 + nvidia driver.

I've been running this for 3 days with complete success on F34 and Gnome with X11 and the NVidia proprietary driver.  Normal browsing, media replay, screenshots and addons are all working well.  Conferencing, pinned tabs, anything I've tried with configuration also works well.
